channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Timing of lights is wrong - the lights are green but cars are still coming over the bridge, 25th October
item.description:
The lights will be green while vehicles are still coming over the bridge from the opposite direction. This happens from both sides
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corner of newly installed anti slip surface corner broken off and not secure, 25th October
item.description:
Your contractors have only just finished working on 4 locations on the A38 which included beige colour anti slip pads and adjacent tarmacing. 2 of the locations are situated where the footpath crosses the road into Villard Close (I live at number 24) and at the northern /Tewkesbury side one corner is loose/broken off & is not securely attached to the ground forming a slip or trip hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Villard Close, Leigh, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Sequencing of lights has changed, 25th October
item.description:
The sequencing of these lights have changed in the last few weeks, causing queues on the main roads. During peak times the queue on the A40 from cheltenham is over 1mile long. And coming out of gloucester for about 1/2 a mile. Please adjust these lights to give more priority to the main road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nine Elms Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: The traffic light has been vandalised

Please raise job for new giveway

item.title: Noisy manhole cover, 25th October
item.description:
The manhole cover on Farm Lane close to the Brizen Lane junction (photos below) which is making a loud clatter each time a car passes over. I have had a look but it unclear who would responsible for getting it fixed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farm Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 25th October
item.description:
Recently resurfaced road has caused a tree to be low hanging. There are several branches that are being hit by large sided vehicles and this is damaged. This should have been sorted before resurfacing.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vegetation over growing footpath, 25th October
item.description:
The vegetation has overgrown the footpath on the racecourse hill such that part of the footpath have only 60cm width for pedestrians. If someone is walking down the hill and a large vehicle is driving down the road close to the footpath there is a danger that their mirrors will overhang the footpath and could hit the pedestrian, with the possibility of serious injury, as they will not observe the vehicle. The vegetation needs cleared back to widen the footpath.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Swindon, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 25th October
item.description:
Can you check to see if the land highlighted below is the responsibility of highways and if the tree can be looked at please, location & map attached separately Many thanks
Report on FixMyStreet

. We have put the paint around the potholes ourselves because they are so bad and we can't see them at night.

item.title: Over 10 potholes each deeper than the width of a tennis ball and the potholes are in a 10 metre long cluster, 25th October
item.description:
It is a single track lane where I have dropped the pin

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 25th October
item.description:
The tree above is now VERY large and tall. The leaves and branches fall on to the pavement and road which can be very dangerous in wet and icy conditions.Due to the new housing estate the path is now very busy. A neighbour and I try to keep the path clear by picking up the debris. The tree was Polled about 5 years ago but nothing since so it is now very big and also covers the street light. Would be grateful if you could see what could be done to ensure safety and also looks very untidy. The tree is a eucalyptus willow which at times the leaves give off a sticky substance which sticks to cars and very difficult to remove. Please could you see what you can do about this issue. Many thanks
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked public footpath, 25th October
item.description:
The public footpath from Innsworth Lane to Swallow Crescent/Gray Close is blocked by nettles and other vegetation. I attempted to walk along it today but had to turn back as I'm somewhat infirm
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Innsworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Excessive amount of mud on road, 25th October
item.description:
Innsworth Lane from Frogfurlong Lane to Innsworth industrial estate. The lorries from Whittle Gardens are carrying mud from the site onto Innsworth Lane. It is blocking drains, making the road filthy most of the way to Churchdown and causing a huge amount of car washing

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 25th October
item.description:
email rcvd 24.10.23 - Hello, I am writing to let you know that there is a very nasty pothole posing serious danger to cyclists on A40 westbound, opposite Balcarras Farm. It is deep, narrow and sharp, plus very hard to see. I was cycling home on Sunday 15th October. A string of cars was passing and I could not deviate, consequently I hit the pothole which caused an immediate pinch flat in the tyre (not inner tube). I was very lucky not to come off the bike as the cars were passing. The whole length of the A40 in Charlton Kings is in terrible condition in both directions and eventually there will be a serious accident involving cyclists. I attach photos of the pothole and invoice for the repair to the tyre.The wheel is also damaged but remains usable, despite the cosmetic appearance (a shame since it is an expensive, new bike). I would kindly ask that; 1. urgent attention is given to the road surface repair 2. you consider compensation for the damage to my bike (invoice attached) Thank you
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Coberley, Cotswold

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 25th October
item.description:
Repair originally raised under job 42490967 (incomplete due to parked cars) has been completed at location today to repair damaged footway. The repair completed has involved filling the entire hole in the footway with tarmac, which has completely blocked the properties' down-pipe and kerbside outlet - residents requesting this be resolved
Report on FixMyStreet
